intro: Matthaea sancta var. mindanaoensis, commonly known as the Mindanao Matthaea, is a rare flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest undergrowth. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
